required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study on Sitagliptin for Assessment of Glucose-lowering Effects (0431-045)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study on Sitagliptin -Assessment of Glucose-lowering Effects

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical study determines the safety and efficacy of sitagliptin (MK0431) in patients with Type 2 diabetes mellitus who have inadequate glycemic control on diet/exercise therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Weighted Mean Plasma Glucose
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 4 is defined as 24-hour weighted mean glucose (24hr-WMG) at Week 4 minus 24hr-WMG at Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 4 is defined as fasting plasma glucose at Week 4 minus fasting plasma glucose at Week 0.

intervention.description: 100 mg once daily (QD), taken orally for 4 weeks
Placebo tablet, QD, taken orally for 4 weeks
50 mg twice daily (BID), taken orally for 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients Have Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus On Diet/Exercise Therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients Have Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

link.description: MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information
Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

reference.citation: Nonaka K, Tsubouchi H, Okuyama K, Fukao Y, Johnson-Levonas AO, Amatruda JM. Effects of once-daily sitagliptin on 24-h glucose control following 4 weeks of treatment in Japanese patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus. Horm Metab Res. 2009 Mar;41(3):232-7. doi: 10.1055/s-0028-1100413. Epub 2009 Feb 27.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase II. First patient in: 31 July 2005. Last patient, last visit: 13 February 2006. The study was conducted at 8 centers in Japan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients 20-69 years of age with type 2 diabetes mellitus and inadequate glycemic control (HbA1c ≥6.5% and <10% at Week -2) were eligible for randomization following at least 8 weeks of diet/exercise and antihyperglycemic agent (AHA) wash-off (for patients previously on an AHA), including a 2-week placebo run-in.

group.title: Sitagliptin 100 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 100 mg QD group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 100 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Sitagliptin 50 mg BID
group.description: The Sitagliptin 50 mg BID group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 50 mg orally twice daily (BID=twice daily).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The Placebo group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo orally.

participants_list.participants: Study enrolled slightly more than the target of N=20
Study enrolled slightly more than the target of N=20
Study enrolled slightly more than the target of N=20

group.title: Sitagliptin 100 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 100 mg QD group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 100 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Sitagliptin 50 mg BID
group.description: The Sitagliptin 50 mg BID group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 50 mg orally twice daily (BID=twice daily).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The Placebo group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo orally.

measure.title: 24-hour weighted mean plasma glucose (24hr-WMG)
measure.description: The 24hr-WMG is the weighted mean of the blood glucose weighted by the intervals between time points for a day [i.e. the area under curve in glucose–time profile through 24-hours (AUC0-24 hr) divided by 24].

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Weighted Mean Plasma Glucose
outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 4 is defined as 24-hour weighted mean glucose (24hr-WMG) at Week 4 minus 24hr-WMG at Week 0.
outcome.population: The Per Protocol population included patients with baseline and Week 4 (i.e., final primary timepoint) values for this outcome and excluded patients who met predefined criteria for protocol violations.

group.title: Sitagliptin 100 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 100 mg QD group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 100 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Sitagliptin 50 mg BID
group.description: The Sitagliptin 50 mg BID group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 50 mg orally twice daily (BID=twice daily).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The Placebo group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo orally.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in 24-hour Weighted Mean Plasma Glucose
measure.description: Change from baseline at Week 4 is defined as 24-hour weighted mean glucose (24hr-WMG) at Week 4 minus 24hr-WMG at Week 0.
measure.population: The Per Protocol population included patients with baseline and Week 4 (i.e., final primary timepoint) values for this outcome and excluded patients who met predefined criteria for protocol violations.

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment among the pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin against placebo
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment as a factor and baseline value as a covariate was used for pairwise comparison
analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment as a factor and baseline value as a covariate was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment among the pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin against placebo

analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment as a factor and baseline value as a covariate was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

outcome.population: The Per Protocol population included patients with baseline and Week 4 (i.e., final primary timepoint) values for this outcome and excluded patients who met predefined criteria for protocol violations.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Reported overdoses, regardless of association with reported adverse events, were considered as serious adverse events in this study. The patients for whom the event of overdose was reported had no concomitant AEs with the overdose.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
